column4: Hi.. I got like 3 kernel images installed... which should i uninstall and wich not??
When i boot i got like 6 slots just for ubuntu
=S
Thats why =/
Thanks
You have two per kernel (regular, and rescue mode)
they're probably all the same kernel, just different versions (upgraded), so, the most recent is the one to keep.
when ubuntu upgrades, it adds the most recent kernel to the top of the list.  If you remove the older ones with apt (or any frontend) the others will go away
uninstall them, and they will be removed from grub
right
no, type that at a terminal, and you'll get the kernel you're currently using
celerons are 686
386 is generic, 386 works on 686, 686 doesn't on 386.
install linux-image-686, it'll keep you updated on the 686 kernels
get the alternate install CD, install just the server (type "server" at the first screen), then install some other WMs (*box, etc)
partitions don't have owners
you need to fix your umask, in fstab
update what?
read that page
don't read that page ;)  read what Madpilot wrote
You might look into firestarter, it's a GUI frontend to iptables
you can.  I don't know how.  But, you could ask in #iptables, I'm sure they can help you
